page.title: 10QUARRIES IN RATHO
page.content: MANY SPECIALISED MACHINES ARE USED AT THE QUARRY. THE MAIN DIGGER AT THE ROCK FACE WEIGHS 68 TONNES. ANOTHER SPECIALISED MACHINE IS THE MACHINE THAT DOES THE BORING FOR THE BLASTING. IT IS CAPABLE OF BORING A FOUR INCH HOLE AT THE RATE OF ABOUT FORTY FEET AN HOUR. SAFETY IS AN IMPORTANT FACTOR. MEN WORK IN PAIRS AND ONE MAN IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OTHERS SAFETY. NATURALLY NORMAL SAFETY PRECAUTIONS LIKE HARD HATS AND SAFETY GUARDS ARE OBLIGATORY. THERE IS STILL A HUGE RESERVE OF STONE LEFT IN THE QUARRY AND IT WILL BE MANY YEARS BEFORE THIS RUNS OUT. WHEN THE LAST OF THE ROCK HAS BEEN REMOVED, THE QUARRY, LIKE OTHERS IN THE AREA, WILL BE FILLED WITH RUBBISH, LANDSCAPED OVER AND RETURNED TO ITS ORIGINAL USE.
